definition: an alloy, usually of lead and tin, used when melted to join two metal surfaces, to join or fuse with solder
details:
noun
- an alloy, usually of lead and tin, used when melted to join two metal surfaces
= example: an alloy, usually of lead and tin, used when melted to join two metal surfaces
verb
- to join or fuse with solder
= example: to join or fuse with solder
